content.question: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations.Rosebushes are known to produce rose blooms during their blooming period. A botanist (plant expert) plans to examine the number of rose blooms during the blooming period for a certain variety of rosebush. A previous publication states that the population distribution of the number of rose blooms during the blooming period for this variety of rosebush is skewed to the left with mean <math alttext="mu equals 4.6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4.6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and standard deviation <math alttext="sigma equals 1.4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>σ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1.4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.(a) Describe the sampling distribution of the sample mean number of rose blooms during the blooming period, <math alttext="x bar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow></mstyle></math>, for random samples of <math alttext="49" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>49</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> rosebushes of this variety from the population.

frqParts.text: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations.Rosebushes are known to produce rose blooms during their blooming period. A botanist (plant expert) plans to examine the number of rose blooms during the blooming period for a certain variety of rosebush. A previous publication states that the population distribution of the number of rose blooms during the blooming period for this variety of rosebush is skewed to the left with mean <math alttext="mu equals 4.6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4.6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and standard deviation <math alttext="sigma equals 1.4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>σ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1.4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.(a) Describe the sampling distribution of the sample mean number of rose blooms during the blooming period, <math alttext="x bar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow></mstyle></math>, for random samples of <math alttext="49" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>49</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> rosebushes of this variety from the population.

(b) Calculate and interpret the value of <math alttext="the probability of, x bar is greater than 5.2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo>(</mo><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover><mo>></mo><mn>5.2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> in the context of the question.

The botanist conducted a study to investigate whether there is a difference between the number of rose blooms during the blooming period for rosebushes of this variety when one of two types of fertilizers is applied to the soil. The botanist randomly assigned <math alttext="70" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>70</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> rosebushes of this variety from a local nursery to receive one of the two fertilizers just before the blooming period, with <math alttext="35" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>35</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> receiving Fertilizer C and <math alttext="35" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>35</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> receiving Fertilizer D. An employee of the nursery, who was not aware of each rosebush’s assigned fertilizer, counted the number of rose blooms observed during the blooming period for each rosebush. The results of the study are shown in the following dotplots. (c) Based on the dotplots, write a few sentences comparing the distributions of the number of rose blooms during the blooming period for the rosebushes that received Fertilizer C and the rosebushes that received Fertilizer D.

The botanist will conduct a hypothesis test to investigate whether the sample data provide convincing statistical evidence that there is a difference between the two population means. Let <math alttext="mu sub C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the mean number of rose blooms during the blooming period for all rosebushes similar to those in the study that could have been given Fertilizer C, and let <math alttext="mu sub D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the mean number of rose blooms during the blooming period for all rosebushes similar to those in the study that could have been given Fertilizer D. The hypotheses for the test are as follows. <math alttext="H sub 0: mu sub C equals mu sub D. H sub a: mu sub C is not equal to mu sub D." overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub><mspace linebreak="newline"></mspace><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub><mo>≠</mo><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> (d) After examining the two dotplots, the botanist is concerned that a condition for the test may not be satisfied. Explain why the botanist should not be concerned.

A <math alttext="98 percent" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>98</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> confidence interval for a difference between the population means (Fertilizer C minus Fertilizer D) is <math alttext="negative 0.743 plus or minus 1.005" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.743</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>1.005</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.(e) Based on the confidence interval, what conclusion should the botanist make for the hypothesis test? Justify your answer.

(f) Based on the conclusion from part (e), describe, in the context of the study, the type of error (Type <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> or Type <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>I</mi><mi>I</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>) the botanist might have made, and also describe a consequence of making this type of error.

topic.text: 1.9: Comparing Distributions of a Quantitative Variable

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Compare distributions or relative positions of points within a distribution.
